Hi, Phil.
Hi.

Yes.
Asia Bibi used to work on a farm.

His story now is that the CIA drugged him and abducted him when he was on a pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia a year ago, and used psychological and physical torture to keep him in the U.S.
That was the story he told, at any rate, at a news conference yesterday in Tehran.

They wanted me to announce that I had come to seek asylum in the United States of my own free will, he said, and that I handed over some very important documents contained in a laptop, including secrets about Iran's nuclear issue.

How he escaped from the CIA's clutches, how he was able to post videos of himself on the Internet, how he managed to turn up at Iran's diplomatic interest section in Washington.

Iran's government has imposed strict travel controls on individuals connected to the nuclear program, yet Amiri was permitted to travel to Saudi Arabia where he disappeared.
